title: Parliament Monsoon session LIVE Day 6: Houses set for fiery debate on Pahalgam attack, Operation Sindoor
content: Both the government and Opposition have consented to a marathon 16-hour debate in each House, which invariably stretches longer in practice

title: Himachal Pradesh suffers losses of ₹1500 crore during ongoing monsoon season
content: So far, 88 people have died and 35 have gone missing in rain-related incidents, and 1,316 houses have been fully or partially damaged in the state

title: When all are treated equally, conflicts end, peace prevails, says Dingaleshwar Swami
content: The seer said that had it not been for Sufi saints and reformers like Basavanna and other sharanas, rivers of blood would have flown in the country

title: In Gujarat’s Amreli, a bedroom behind bars
content: A widowed farmer has formed a “human cage” to defend  the prowling leopards that stalk his rented farm, turning their lives into a nightly battle for survival

title: Police officers’ association condemns YSRCP leaders’ remarks
content: Former Minister Ambati Rambabu’s statement that a rowdy sheet will be opened against an IPS officer is unacceptable in a democratic set-up, the association says

title: Activists demand Devadasi survey without condition of age limit
content: The centuries-old practice of dedication of women to temples as Devadasis has been banned in the State since 1982 when the Karnataka Devadasis (Prohibition of Dedication) Act was enacted

title: Govt. offers special package of incentives to Kadapa steel plant
content: The JSW Steel Limited intends to begin construction of first phase of the plant in January 2026 and begin commercial production by April 2029

title: CBI arrests three in cybercrime case
content: During the investigation, the CBI unearthed the entire conspiracy of opening the mule account by the bankers without “proper KYC norms” or “Customer Due Diligence” or “Initial Risk Assessment”

title: Gujarat approves action plan for Artificial Intelligence implementation in governance
content: Implementation will be carried out in phases, starting with the creation of a State-level AI data repository, setting up AI development facilities, and launching pilot projects in selected departments

title: ‘Mughal period saw violence; Britain did not recognise suffering inflicted on colonies’: Michel Danino
content: Michel Danino, IIT Gandhinagar Guest Professor and head of NCERT’s Social Science textbook team, on historical framing in the new class seven and eight textbooks, media criticism, and debates over representation

title: ZSI scientists discover a wolf spider, and four wasp species from West Bengal
content: Piratula acuminata marks the first record of the genus Piratula in India; in a separate study, ZSI researchers identified and described four new species of parasitoid wasps belonging to the genus Idris

title: BRS urges Telangana HC to step in over recurring food poisoning incidents in residential schools
content: Party leaders led by T. Harish Rao visit Uyyalawada where 111 students had taken ill due to suspected food poisoning

title: DRDO pushes for hypersonic edge against evolving air threats
content: Top defence scientists deliberated on the performance of the indigenous hi-tech missile systems such as Akash air-defence, Brahmos, MRSAM, ULPGM, all of which were developed at the missile complex in Hyderabad

title: Muslim hawker assaulted in Meerut; attempt to create fear, says opposition
content: While locals claim the victim was mistaken for a thief, his wife alleged they are being forced to modify the complaint

title: TGSWREIS records 5-year high Inter admission rate at 86.7%
content: Of 19,680 available seats, 17,100 have already been filled; emaining institution-wise vacancies will be filled through spot counselling scheduled for July 31

title: Jammu ‘shoot-out’: J&K Police take suspended policemen to crime site, seize service rifle, victim’s bike
content: Officials said the SIT, headed by a Deputy Superintendent of Police-rank officer, visited the site in Satwari where the incident took place on July 24

title: Mamata launches ‘language movement’, condemns targeting of migrant’s family in Delhi
content: Migrants from West Bengal have been detained in different states like Odisha, Haryana and Delhi on suspicion of being Bangladeshi nationals.

title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi soaks in spiritual experience on his visit to Gangaikonda Cholapuram
content: He offers prayers at the Brihadisvara temple, built by Rajendra Chola I, which is famous for its imposing architecture and exquisite sculptures

title: Clearing the air on ‘citizenship’ in Bihar poll roll revision
content: The political objections being raised on the issue of citizenship reveal a lack of knowledge of the Constitution, legislation and the working of the electoral system

title: ‘Su From So’: How an unheralded Kannada film broke marketing norms to set box office records
content: The Raj B Shetty-produced ‘Su From So’, a surprise hit of 2025, breaks box office records with minimal promotion, emphasising quality content over excessive marketing

title: Bihar SIR: 91.69% have submitted enumeration forms, says Election Commission of India
content: Of the 7.89 crore registered electors as on June 24, over 7.24 crore had submitted enumeration forms indicating overwhelming participation, the poll body says

title: Senior Living Conclave 2025 held in Chennai
content: The conclave emphaised the importance of design and healthcare features such as anti-skid flooring, emergency response systems and access to on-call doctors in making homes safer for seniors

title: Detainees being released, but crackdown on ‘illegal immigrants’ continues in Gurugram, say police
content: The drive has drawn widespread criticism over the alleged harassment of detainees and targeting of Bengali-speaking migrant workers from Assam and West Bengal

title: RESA extension work at Calicut airport in progress
content: Though the project is scheduled to be completed by March next year, the construction company has sought an extension of three months because of the delay caused by the rain

title: New Zealand kayakers steal the show at 11th edition of Malabar River Festival finale
content: Among the Indian kayakers, Arjun Singh Rawat secured the top position, followed by Amar Singh Ankit and Kuldeep Singh in second and third place, respectively

title: Surbana Jurong and Eversendai show interest to invest in Andhra Pradesh
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu invites Surbana Jurong to play a pivotal role in the State’s ‘Housing for All’ initiative; Eversendai Engineering proposes establishment of a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility and an integrated training center

title: Digital recreation of Portuguese Fort at Chaliyam in final stages
content: The fort was built at the mouth of Beypore river around 1530, reportedly with the support of local chieftains opposed to Calicut kingdom. It was constructed at a strategic location to corner Zamorin

title: Cong., IUML express concern over draft voters’ list
content: Kozhikode DCC to approach HC over alleged discrepancies in the draft voters’ list for local body polls; names of a large number of voters missing in list, says Local Government Members’ League

title: Bought for Rs 90,000, sold as IVF baby for Rs 35 lakh; how clinic gave away newborns
content: Hyderabad police uncovered a surrogacy scam at Universal Srushti Fertility Centre, arresting eight individuals, including Dr. Athaluri Namratha, for allegedly selling infants to couples under the guise of IVF. The clinic, operating without a valid license since 2021, deceived a couple who paid Rs 35 lakh, providing them with a baby unrelated to them.

title: SC takes up SIR: 35L voters missing; Oppn mounts pressure – explained in 10 points
content: A dispute surrounds the Election Commission's revision of voter lists in Bihar. Opposition parties allege voter suppression. They have taken the matter to the Supreme Court. The court is hearing the case. The Election Commission defends the revision as necessary for fair elections. Concerns arise about voter verification and potential disenfranchisement. The revision may extend nationwide.

title: Cash-at-home controversy: Judge Varma hides identity, is ‘XXX’ in his SC petition - details
content: Justice Yashwant Varma, facing a Parliament removal motion over cash found at his residence, has anonymously petitioned the Supreme Court to quash the inquiry report and the former CJI's recommendation for his removal. The Supreme Court is set to hear his plea, alongside another petition seeking an FIR against him.

title: Police constable’s wife dies by suicide in UP, alleges harassment by in-laws
content: Saumya Kashyap, the wife of a Uttar Pradesh police constable, tragically died by suicide, leaving behind an Instagram video accusing her in-laws of severe harassment. She alleged they pressured her husband to remarry and that her brother-in-law threatened her life. Authorities were alerted after the video surfaced, and an investigation is underway following the notification of Saumya's family.

title: ISI-backed arms, drug racket busted: Consignment linked to Bhagwanpuria aide; 5 held
content: Punjab Police, working with central agencies, dismantled an ISI-backed trans-border smuggling ring, arresting five operatives. The operation seized assault rifles, pistols, ammunition, drug money, and a vehicle. Investigations revealed direct links between the arrested individuals and Pakistani ISI handlers, with the consignment intended for a close associate of gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria, highlighting a terror-gangster connection.

title: Google DeepMind CEO on Meta AI hiring: ‘There's more important things than just money, one has to…’
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis commented on Meta's AI hiring spree, suggesting it's a strategic move to catch up in the field. Hassabis emphasized that many AI professionals prioritize the responsible development of the technology over financial gains. He also recalled the early days of AI research when funding was scarce.

title: IND vs ENG | The final-hour handshake drama at Old Trafford
content: Ravindra Jadeja, Washington Sundar, and Shubman Gill's centuries powered India to a morale-boosting draw in the fourth Test against England. Despite a handshake offer from Ben Stokes, Jadeja and Sundar continued batting, facing some verbal exchanges, ultimately reaching their respective centuries. The match concluded with handshakes and reflections on valuable learnings.

title: Two devotees electrocuted outside Awshaneshwar temple in Barabanki
content: In Barabanki district, a tragic incident occurred outside the Awshaneshwar Mahadev temple, resulting in the electrocution of two devotees and injuries to several others. The incident happened when they came into contact with an electrified iron pipe and tin shed erected for monsoon shelter. Authorities are investigating the cause, suspecting faulty wiring or leakage.

title: 'Aid must be permitted to reach people': Obama voices concern over Gaza
content: Barack Obama has called for immediate action to prevent starvation in Gaza, emphasizing the urgent need for aid access. While Israel announced a "tactical pause," Trump accused Hamas of diverting aid, a claim disputed by the Israeli military. Netanyahu defended Israel's aid efforts, accusing the UN of spreading falsehoods regarding humanitarian access.

title: ‘War Cry': Angry Altman responds to Zuckerberg 'poaching' OpenAI employees
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has responded to Meta's aggressive AI talent poaching, calling it a "war cry" and confidently declaring his intention to win. This follows Meta's recruitment of several OpenAI researchers for its Meta Superintelligence Labs, reportedly offering lucrative compensation packages. The competition for top AI talent intensifies as Meta aims to strengthen its AI capabilities.

title: Out on bail, murder accused actor Darshan returns from Thailand trip
content: Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, implicated in Renukaswamy's murder case, has returned to Bengaluru from Thailand. He was granted court permission to travel for the shooting of his film 'Devil'. Darshan, along with his girlfriend Pavithra Gowda and fifteen others, were previously arrested in connection with the murder that occurred in June last year.

title: IND vs ENG: Old Trafford and Draws – Another match ends without result
content: Old Trafford's reputation as a draw specialist solidified as the India-England Test ended in a stalemate, marking the fifth consecutive drawn first-class match at the venue this season. India, after trailing significantly, fought back with centuries from Shubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja, and Washington Sundar. Ben Stokes and Joe Root achieved individual milestones amidst the drawn Test.

title: 'Settled India-Pak, now it's Thailand-Cambodia'; Trump credits trade pressure, calls it 'honour'
content: Donald Trump claimed on Sunday that he intervened to settle the India-Pakistan ceasefire, reiterating a past assertion while discussing conflict between Thailand and Cambodia. He stated he warned the prime ministers of Thailand and Cambodia that trade deals hinged on ceasing hostilities. Trump suggested his intervention prevented a potential conflict between India and Pakistan.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 bn worth of Amazon shares, now holds stock valued at…
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: Pickup truck carrying 25 people plunges into Sirhind Canal near Ludhiana; 6 dead
content: A tragic accident occurred near Jagera bridge in Maloud as a pickup truck carrying devotees returning from Naina Devi temple plunged into the Sirhind Canal. The incident resulted in the death of four individuals, including two children, and left three others missing.

title: Handshake denied! Washington Sundar cold-shoulders Harry Brook, video goes viral - WATCH
content: India showcased resilience, securing a draw against England in the fourth Test after batting for 143 overs. Ravindra Jadeja's century and Washington Sundar's maiden ton rescued India from a significant first-innings deficit. Despite England's imposing 669, India's fightback, highlighted by Gill's century and Rahul's 90, ensured a draw.

title: Cincinnati shocker: Man stomped, woman knocked out in brawl
content: A shocking video from Cincinnati shows a man and woman violently attacked during a downtown brawl. The man was chased, beaten, and stomped on, while the woman was punched unconscious when she tried to help. Police are investigating the incident, sparked by a possible exchange of racial slurs.

title: 'Pant batted with broken foot': Gambhir backs injury subs; Stokes calls debate 'ridiculous'
content: Rishabh Pant has been ruled out of the final Test against England due to a foot fracture sustained during the fourth Test, where he bravely batted through the pain to score a half-century. Coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Pant's courage, sparking debate about injury replacements in Test cricket, a proposal opposed by England captain Ben Stokes.

title: Did Epstein introduce Melania to Trump? Biographer makes bold claim
content: Michael Wolff has stirred controversy by alleging Jeffrey Epstein played a role in introducing Melania Trump to Donald Trump. Wolff claims Melania was involved in Epstein's social circle and connected through Paolo Zampolli. Melania denies this, saying she met Trump at the Kit Kat Klub. Despite Trump's attempts to distance himself, photos and Epstein's claims suggest otherwise.

title: Nine from Gujarat indicted in US for running $9.5m illegal gambling biz
content: A high-profile federal crackdown in the US has led to the indictment of nine Gujarati men for allegedly running a multi-million-dollar illegal gambling operation across six Missouri locations. Disguised as skill game arcades, the businesses reportedly grossed over $9.5 million between 2022 and 2025.

title: Indian team breaks multiple records — most centuries, 350+ totals and more
content: India's batting prowess shone brightly in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, securing a draw in the fourth Test at Old Trafford and rewriting record books. Washington Sundar's century contributed to India equaling their record of 11 centuries in a series, matching their 1978-79 feat against West Indies. The team also set a new record with seven 350-plus totals, surpassing Australia's previous best.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for week starting July 28 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends VA Tech WABAG, a water treatment leader with a strong order book and growth potential, driven by increasing water demand and strategic initiatives. HDFC Bank is also favored, expected to see earnings rebound through loan growth and margin recovery, supported by robust asset quality and provisioning buffers, projecting strong RoA/RoE.

title: 'A Test 100 is a Test 100': Gill defends Jadeja-Sundar's refusal to accept early draw
content: Shubman Gill defended Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's pursuit of centuries on Day 5 of the drawn fourth Test against England. Gill emphasised that both deserved their hundreds after their impressive partnership rescued India from a precarious position. Despite England's frustration and Ben Stokes's sarcastic remarks, Jadeja and Sundar remained composed, guiding India to a respectable draw.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ BO collection: Mohit Suri’s film earns Rs 247.25 crore; Ahaan & Aneet shine
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, continues its successful run at the box office, earning Rs. 247.25 crore in India after 10 days. The film witnessed a significant jump in collections during its second weekend, reaching Rs. 44.5 crore in two days. 'Saiyaara' has become the second-highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025, surpassing 'Housefull 5'.

title: Jadeja rewrites Test history, equals Sobers' 59-year-old record in England
content: Ravindra Jadeja has matched Sir Garfield Sobers' 1966 record, achieving five 50+ scores at No.6 or lower in a Test series in England. His unbeaten 107 in the fourth Test helped India secure a draw. Jadeja's consistent performance places him alongside Sobers in elite lists, with over 1000 runs and 30+ wickets in England.

title: Drug lab in buffalo barn busted, Rs 50cr drugs, tools seized
content: A joint operation by Rajasthan and Maharashtra police, along with the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), dismantled a drug cartel operating from a buffalo barn in Barmer, Rajasthan. Authorities seized drugs and equipment worth Rs 50 crore, including Mephedrone and Ketamine, from the Barmer site and Raigad, Maharashtra. The investigation revealed a network of clandestine labs and led to multiple arrests, highlighting the NCB's efforts to combat synthetic drug manufacturing.

title: Government identifies key sectors to attract foreign investors
content: Amid global economic uncertainty and fluctuating FDI inflows, the Indian government is actively targeting specific sectors like electronics, footwear, chemicals, medical devices, toys, and EVs to attract foreign investment. Efforts include leveraging production-linked incentive schemes and building resilient supply chains to reduce reliance on China.

title: Bihar's draft poll roll may exclude 66 lakh names: EC
content: The Election Commission of India announced a potential exclusion of 6.6 million names from Bihar's draft electoral roll. These exclusions are due to electors registering in other states, being deceased, permanently shifting, or failing to submit required forms. The EC emphasized the "overwhelming participation" in the special intensive revision, with over 72 million forms submitted.

title: TCS to axe 12,000 jobs; IT giant’s biggest layoff ever
content: TCS, India's largest IT firm, will lay off 12,261 employees, about 2% of its workforce, due to AI disruptions and uncertain business demand. This significant restructuring aims to transform TCS into a future-ready organization. The job cuts primarily affect mid-level and senior executives, reflecting a strategic shift towards embracing AI and automation.

title: India's ambassador to Cuba ends up with 2 wives, SC seeks solution
content: The Supreme Court addressed a complex matrimonial situation involving Indian Ambassador Thongkomang Armstrong Changsan, who remarried after a customary divorce deemed invalid by the Gauhati High Court. The court showed no sympathy for Changsan, whose first marriage, solemnized in a church, was improperly dissolved by village elders.

title: Study reveals why men need to lower their standards on dating apps
content: A new study analyzes dating app behavior in Czech Republic. It reveals men pursue more desirable partners. Women seek similar desirability levels. Successful matches occur between equals. Men may need to lower standards for romance. Netizens debate the findings. Some question the study's relevance to Western cultures. Others share personal experiences. The debate continues on dating app standards. Read below!

title: New self-confidence in India post Sindoor: PM Modi before Parliament debate
content: Prime Minister Modi, ahead of a crucial parliamentary debate on the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, asserted India's firm stance against terrorism. Speaking in Tamil Nadu, Modi emphasized that the precision strikes in Pakistan sent a clear message: terrorists have no safe havens. He highlighted the operation's role in fostering national self-confidence.

title: Ex-Maharashtra mantri kin, 6 others held in Pune drug party bust
content: Eknath Khadse's son-in-law, Pranjal Khewalkar, and six others were arrested in Pune during a raid on a Kharadi apartment. Police seized cocaine, marijuana, hookah pots, and liquor. Khewalkar, along with the others, faces charges under the NDPS Act and COTPA, with the court granting police custody until Tuesday as investigations continue into potential drug sources and networks.

title: ‘Bihar rape accused hired through private firm’: Health department
content: In Gaya, an ambulance driver and technician, employed through a private agency, are accused of raping a home guard job aspirant. The health department clarified they are not regular employees, shifting responsibility for background checks to the agency.

title: Ciara turns heads in jean shorts: Effortlessly outshines Wilson at training camp
content: Russell Wilson joins the New York Giants. Ciara grabs attention at training camp. She wore stylish denim shorts and a custom Wilson jersey. The couple's fashion sense is a game-changer. They celebrated Win's birthday. The Wilson-Ciara dynamic blends football, fashion, and family. Fans eagerly anticipate Ciara's sideline outfits. The family's bond appears stronger than ever. Baby Amora resembles her dad.

title: 8 dead, 28 injured in stampede at Haridwar’s Mansa Devi temple
content: A tragic stampede near Haridwar's Mansa Devi temple claimed eight lives and injured 28 others on Sunday morning. The incident, possibly triggered by rumors of electrocution, occurred on the pedestrian route with over 5,000 devotees present. Chief Minister Dhami announced compensation for the victims' families and ordered a probe.

title: ED probes Anil’s RHFL for writing off Rs 7k cr loans to group firms
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating Anil Ambani's Reliance group for allegedly diverting ₹12,000 crore from Reliance Home Finance Ltd (RHFL) to related entities. Assisted by multiple agencies, the ED is scrutinizing transactions involving 22 individuals and 60 companies. A SEBI report highlights alleged fund laundering, with RHFL writing off ₹7,000 crore in loans to Anil Ambani linked entities.

title: Interfaith marriages without religious conversion illegal: Alld HC
content: The Allahabad High Court declared interfaith marriages without religious conversion illegal and refused to dismiss criminal proceedings against a man accused of marrying a minor in an Arya Samaj temple. The court directed an investigation into Arya Samaj temples issuing marriage certificates without following regulations.

title: Rajkot: Daughter, 12, raped by father over 6 months
content: In Rajkot, a 12-year-old girl was allegedly molested and raped by her father over six months, according to police reports. The mother filed a complaint, leading to charges under the BNS Act and Pocso Act. The accused, a Nepalese security guard, fled after his wife discovered the abuse on July 25. Police are currently searching for him using various methods.

title: Adventure turns terror: 300 trekkers, including 100 women, rescued
content: Heavy rainfall caused the Kalu river to swell, stranding 300 trekkers, including 100 women, in the Malshej Ghat forest. A seven-hour rescue operation involving forest staffers and locals successfully brought the trekkers, mainly from Hyderabad, Mumbai, and Pune, to safety using ropes and ziplines.

title: Cops begin probe as Bihar deputy CM Samrat Choudhary gets death threat
content: Bihar's Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary received a death threat via an instant message, warning of a shooting within 24 hours. The message, sent to a party worker, prompted tightened security at Choudhary's residence and public events.

title: Trial court not the first stop for investigation, says Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that trial courts cannot directly entertain complaints seeking police investigation of cognisable offences. Before approaching a court, individuals must first seek FIR registration with the jurisdictional police. Magistrates should direct informants to approach the officer-in-charge and then the Superintendent of Police before considering applications under Section 156(3) of the CrPC.

title: Varma row: Ignoring RS notice illegal, says Congress; 'petty mindset'
content: Congress has criticized BJP's decision to prioritize the Lok Sabha notice regarding Justice Yashwant Varma over the Rajya Sabha notice, alleging it stems from insecurity and a desire to control the narrative. Abhishek Singhvi accused the government of "illegality" and suggested former RS chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar's actions on the Varma issue led to his removal. Singhvi also alleged BJP MPs signed a blank paper, potentially an impeachment notice against Dhankhar.

title: AI crash: Mum’s skin grafts help heal infant’s 36% burns
content: In a harrowing incident following the AI 171 airplane crash, eight-month-old Dhyaansh and his mother, Manisha, suffered severe burns. Manisha's courageous act of saving her child led to both enduring extensive treatment, including skin grafts for Dhyaansh. The dedicated medical team at KD Hospital provided specialized care, ensuring their recovery and eventual discharge, highlighting the strength of a mother's love and medical expertise.

title: Only Dhankhar, PM Modi know real reason behind VP’s exit: Kharge
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge stated he lacks information regarding Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation as Vice President, suggesting it's a matter between Dhankhar and Prime Minister Modi. Kharge noted Dhankhar's consistent support for the government and his reluctance to allow discussions on farmer issues, poverty, and social injustices in the Rajya Sabha.

title: Watch: Hero bystanders stops Walmart stabber; Derrick Perry holds attacker at gunpoint
content: A stabbing attack at a Traverse City Walmart injured 11 people before bystanders intervened. Derrick Perry, identified by family and locals, is being hailed as a hero for drawing his licensed weapon and holding the suspect, Bradford James Gille, at gunpoint. Perry, along with a former Marine who used a shopping cart, stopped Gille until police arrived, preventing further harm.

title: EC must stop SIR, says opposition; calls it ‘exercise of exclusion’
content: Opposition parties in India are raising concerns about the Election Commission's special intensive revision of Bihar's electoral rolls, alleging it could disenfranchise marginalized communities. They question the potential exclusion of 66 lakh people and criticize the rejection of certain documents. The Election Commission defends the process, urging parties to submit claims and objections during the designated period.

title: McCarthy addresses edited video scare: False alarm during Vikings camp
content: A misleading video circulating online falsely depicts J.J. McCarthy throwing five interceptions at a Minnesota Vikings practice. The clip is actually a compilation of older footage, unrelated to the team's 2025 training camp. Coaches affirm McCarthy's progress and readiness as the starting quarterback, emphasizing his growth in film study and situational awareness.

title: Deadline week update! Rankings for the top 50 MLB trade deadline candidates
content: Our running list of who could be traded has some new names in the final few days before the July 31 deadline.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Bubble teams could shape week ahead
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: Ichiro shows funny side, joins CC, Wagner in HOF
content: Ichiro Suzuki's sense of humor was on full display Sunday, when he joined CC Sabathia, Billy Wagner, Dave Parker and Dick Allen in baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: Sources: Royals keeping Lugo on 2 years, $46M
content: Seth Lugo, who had been regarded as one of the best potential trade candidates this deadline season, will remain with the Royals on a two-year, $46 million extension, sources told ESPN.

title: Wallace takes Brickyard; 1st Black winner at Indy
content: Bubba Wallace became the first Black driver to win a major race on Indianapolis Motor Speedway's 2.5-mile oval, surviving a late rain delay, two overtimes, concerns over running out of fuel and a hard-charging Kyle Larson on Sunday in the Brickyard 400.

title: Reports: Liberty's Stewart avoids major leg injury
content: Liberty star Breanna Stewart underwent an MRI that revealed she avoided a significant injury to her right leg, according to reports.

title: Jones listens as fans chant 'Pay Micah!' at camp
content: On Saturday, fans chanted "Pay Micah!" in support of star Micah Parsons getting an extension from the Cowboys.

title: 49ers DE Jackson taken off field via ambulance
content: 49ers DE Tarron Jackson was talking and moving his extremities after sustaining an injury during Sunday's practice.

title: Proper English: Lionesses beat Spain, win Euro
content: England beat Spain 3-1 in a penlty shootout to win Euro 2025 on Sunday, successfully defending the title they won in 2022 after an enthralling encounter.

title: Easy rider: Pogačar wins 4th Tour de France title
content: Tadej Pogačar won his fourth Tour de France title by a comfortable margin ahead of two-time champ Jonas Vingegaard and Florian Lipowitz.

title: England's Euro 2025 win defies logic; Spain's curse continues
content: England were ahead in the Euro 2025 knockouts for just four minutes and 52 seconds. But they beat Spain on penalties to defend their crown.

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Pérez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo Pérez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Ibrahimovic, Messi, Gerrard: The 10 best and 10 worst DPs in MLS history
content: With the MLS transfer window opening Thursday, ESPN looks back at some of the best and worst big-money signings in league history.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: Woad, 21, wins Scottish Open in debut as pro
content: Two weeks ago, Lottie Woad was the world's No. 1 amateur. On Sunday, the 21-year-old Englishwoman became an LPGA Tour champion in her professional debut.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool among clubs eyeing young striker Idrissa Gueye
content: Liverpool are among a host of clubs who have enquired about young Senegal striker Idrissa Gueye. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: "Armed Guards, Phone Jammers": Inside Zohran Mamdani's Lavish Uganda Wedding Bash
content: New York's Indian-origin mayoral frontrunner, Zohran Mamdani, reportedly celebrated his recent marriage to artist and animator Rama Duwaji with a three-day lavish bash at his family's sprawling compound in Uganda.

title: Trump Strikes "Biggest-Ever" Trade Deal With European Union
content: The United States and European Union on Sunday clinched what President Donald Trump described as the "biggest-ever" deal to resolve a transatlantic tariff stand-off that threatened to explode into a full-blown trade war.

title: "Prevent Dying Of Starvation": Barack Obama On Gaza Humanitarian Crisis
content: The Israeli military on Sunday began a limited pause in fighting in three populated areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day amid growing concerns over surging hunger.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 6 Live Updates: Op Sindoor Debate In Lok Sabha Today, Rajnath Singh To Speak At Noon
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will open the debate on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha. Home Minister Amit Shah, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and Prime Minister Narendra Modi are likely to intervene.

title: 2 Dead In Stampede After Panic Over Electric Shock At UP Temple
content: The stampede erupted after an electric shock in the temple premises, causing panic among devotees and resulting in a stampede.

title: 3 Patients Die After 'Technical Snag' Reduced Oxygen Supply At Jalandhar Hospital
content: A sudden drop in oxygen pressure at the Trauma Ward of the Civil Hospital in Jalandhar on Sunday allegedly led to the deaths of three patients, triggering panic in the administration and prompting an inquiry.

title: Couple Finds Surrogate Baby Has No Genetic Links To Them, Doctor Among 10 Arrested In Hyderabad
content: A case of illegal surrogacy and sperm trafficking racket has been busted in Secunderabad, leading to the arrest of ten people, including a doctor - Dr Namrata - who was the manager of Universal Srushti Fertility Centre in Regimental Bazaar.

title: 3 Dead, Many Injured As Train Carrying 100 People Derails In Germany
content: The passenger train was travelling from the German town of Sigmaringen to the city of Ulm when it derailed in a forested area.

title: Bihar Voter List Revision Issue In Supreme Court Today: 10 Points
content: The controversial Special Intensive Revision or SIR of voter lists in Bihar ahead of the assembly election has been challenged in the Supreme Court and the matter would be heard by a two-judge bench today.

title: US Says Tariff Deadline Of August 1 Is Firm, No Extensions
content: The US deadline of August 1 for imposing tariffs on its trading partners is firm and there will be no extensions, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said Sunday.

title: Video: Man Shouts "Going To Bomb The Plane" Mid-Air, Arrested In Scotland
content: A man has been arrested for causing a disturbance on an Easyjet flight from London Luton Airport to Glasgow. A video that has gone viral on social media shows the man shouting, "I am going to bomb the plane".

title: Small Plane Carrying 3 Crashes Off California Coast, Search Underway
content: Authorities are searching for three people who were aboard a private twin-engine plane that crashed off the central California coast.

title: Weather Office Predicts Thunderstorms With Rain In Delhi Today
content: The national capital recorded a maximum temperature of 37.5 degrees Celsius on Sunday, two notches above the season's average, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

title: Babbar Khalsa International Operative, 22, Arrested For Punjab Grenade Attack
content: The Special Cell of the Delhi Police has arrested a 22-year-old man linked to the banned terror group Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) and wanted in connection with a grenade attack in Punjab.

title: Tripura Allies BJP And Tipra Motha Workers Clash During Mann Ki Baat Broadcast
content: In a major political development in Tripura, members of the BJP and its key ally Tipra Motha clashed on Sunday at an area where BJP supporters claimed to have assembled to listen to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's monthly radio broadcast Mann Ki Baat.

title: Israel Begins Daily Pause In Fighting In Parts of Gaza Amid Surging Hunger
content: The Israeli military on Sunday began a limited pause in fighting in three populated areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day, part of measures including airdrops as concerns grow over surging hunger and international criticism.

title: 13-Year-Old Boy Killed For Stealing Pigeon In Punjab, 3 Charged: Police
content: A 13-year-old boy was killed allegedly by three villagers for stealing a pigeon in Punjab's Mansa district, police said on Sunday.

title: "Need To Relook At Our History": Economist As PM Offers Prayers At Iconic Cholapuram Temple
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the Gangaikonda Cholapuram Shiva temple, has put the spotlight on the Chola empire, especially on the time of Rajendra Chola, who stood tall when northern India was under Muslim rule.

title: UP Cop's Wife Alleges Harassment By In-Laws In Video, Dies By Suicide
content: The wife of a police constable in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow died by suicide allegedly over harassment by her in-laws.

title: 8 Dead, 30 Injured In Stampede At Haridwar's Mansa Devi Temple
content: Eight people have died and dozens of devotees suffered injuries in a stampede at the Mansa Devi temple in the holy city of Haridwar in Uttarakhand. The stampede occurred on the staircases on the temple road leading to the main temple.

title: Mallikarjun Kharge recalls how he missed a chance to becoming Chief Minister
content: The AICC president becomes emotional while participating in a function organised in memory of the founders of BLDE Society in Vijayapura

title: Dams continue to release water, flood alert for Bhavani basin
content: Several houses in Chittur taluk were flooded following accumulation of trees at Thiruvazhiyode bridge. Road traffic was affected following uprooting of trees at different parts. District officials said that two dozen houses were damaged in the rain since Saturday

title: CAPF personnel injured during operations will get full benefits till retirement: Union Home Secretary
content: Govind Mohan said the government will ensure the best medical facilities and technology available in the world for ‘limb replacement surgery’ for CAPF officials and jawans and it will be ensured that loss of limbs is corrected as far as possible

title: 'Not found suitable' clause weaponised against SCs, STs, OBCs to deny them job opportunities: Congress
content: Rahul Gandhi also attacked the Modi government over vacant reserved posts for SCs, STs, and OBCs in central universities and said this is not just negligence but a "well-planned conspiracy" to keep "bahujans" out of education, research and policies.

title: NCB, police in Rajasthan and Maharashtra bust inter-State synthetic drug syndicate
content: Clandestine labs uncovered in Barmer and Raigad; precursors and equipment seized, investigation underway

title: Stop SIR in Bihar, refrain from ‘institutional arrogance’, says INDIA bloc
content: Stating that the SIR had become a process of establishing citizenship, Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi asked if the Election Commission was authorised to do so

title: Six BJP workers injured in alleged TIPRA Motha attack in Tripura
content: Clashes occurred during PM’s Mann Ki Baat broadcast in Khowai district; Forest Minister denies party role

title: Critical vulnerability exposed sensitive data of voluntary organ donors
content: After security researcher’s alert, Computer Emergency Response Team plugged the gap in AIIMS portal; in an email to CERT, the researcher had flagged that the vulnerability disclosed personally identifiable and medical information of donors

title: The return of the native
content: After over a decade of wandering and uncertainty, the Kodarvi tribe returned to their village this July following a truce with the Dabhi tribe that had pushed them out of their lands in a tradition called chadotaru. Abhinay Deshpande reports from Gujarat’s Banaskantha district on how the police played a role in the agreement between communities and the rebuilding of their lives

title: A section of Congress leaders rally in support of Satheesan against Vellappally’s attacks
content: K.C. Joseph says criticism of any political leader should conform to accepted standards of public decency. LDF government was prompt in arresting a person for criticising VS, but was reticent in prosecuting Vellappally for ‘spewing communal venom,’ says SYS leader

title: MEA ‘nearly lost the plot’ on Indus Treaty negotiations, says former Finance Secretary Subhash Garg
content: In his new book, No, Minister: Navigating Power, Politics and Bureaucracy with a Steely Resolve, Garg says he was sidelined during the initial stages of the Indus Water Treaty negotiations in 2016

title: TNCC pins its hope on efforts to create “an army” of full-time workers like RSS
content: Since December last year, the party has tried to constitute “verified” committees under the supervision of senior leader Peter Alphonse. The credentials of the committee members are vetted before they are given identity cards. These members will take the party’s ideology and policies directly to the voters

title: Teacher unions oppose ‘forced registration’ in P4 scheme, demand voluntary participation
content: PDF MLC and teacher unions slam pressure tactics by officials, say adoption of families under poverty eradication drive should be optional

title: Stark gap between guidance and market values of properties spurs Karnataka govt. to mull over revision
content: Market value is a whopping 10 times that of the guidance value or even more in several locations in districts abutting Bengaluru

title: MHA refuses to share data on CAA beneficiaries
content: Bengal MP demands relaxation in CAA rules and amendment to cut off-date;The Hindu had filed RTI applications in June 2024 and September 2024, but the MHA refused to provide the information

title: LDF, UDF condemn arrest of two Keralite nuns on ‘trumped-up’ charge of forced conversion in Chhattisgarh
content: Catholic Bishops Conference of India terms the arrest an infringement on the fundamental right to freedom of religion and unrestricted movement, and accuses Bajrang Dal activists of detaining the nuns with police’s connivance

title: Minister assures water to all irrigation projects in  Rayalaseema
content: For the first time in 25 years, we have released Krishna water into Srisailam in July. Similarly, plans are afoot to fill up Adavipalli reservoir with 3,850 cusecs of Krishna water through Handri Neeva canal, says Rama Naidu

title: Thrissur Rural police nab attempted murder accused from Gundlupet hideout
content: Acting on intelligence inputs, a special team tracked the accused to a secluded farmhouse in Shivapura, near Gundlupet, where they had been hiding for the past five days

title: Lokesh appeals to Telugu diaspora to invest in Andhra Pradesh and contribute to its growth
content: Participating in a meeting organised by the A.P. Non-Resident Telugu Society and A.P. Economic Development Board in Singapore, he promises necessary hand-holding to the Telugu entrepreneurs coming forward to partner with the government

title: PM’s visit set to boost tourism in Tiruchi region
content: Gangaikonda Cholapuram emerged as one of the top searched items online since the announcement was made about Prime Minister’s  visit to Brahadisvar Temple about two weeks ago

title: NMC guidelines on live broadcast of surgeries focus on patient welfare, ethical standards
content: Live broadcasts of surgeries should strictly serve educational purposes, and are not for commercial gain; surgeons should avoid glorification, and be responsible in adhering to professional and ethical standards, the guidelines state

title: TNSDMA, WRD issue alert along the banks of the Cauvery
content: In Tiruchi, washermen and other riverside residents have been directly warned and autorickshaws have been deployed to make announcements about the impending flood threat

title: Plea to shift Myanmar Kuki detainees from Imphal jail
content: The rights organisation seeks transfer of Myanmar nationals to prison facilities in Kuki-dominated districts within the State; urges release of detainees held beyond their sentence period

title: New cooperative policy centralises power and snatches rights of State governments, says Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: The farmers’ umbrella body alleges that the policy favours takeover of agriculture sector by corporate sector

title: OBJ reaches out to 14U flag football champion who went viral
